Access to affordable, high-quality child care helps children learn, gives parents breathing room, and helps more parents work.

Today, @POTUS, @AlboMP, and @RishiSunak announced steps to carry forward the Australia – U.K. – U.S. Partnership.

Developing Australia’s conventionally-armed, nuclear-powered submarine capacity and our own will enhance stability in the Indo-Pacific. https://t.co/nZzWt5SbQq

Working people power our economy. When they thrive, our economy thrives.

President Biden’s budget proposes to establish a national, comprehensive paid family and medical leave and calls for paid sick leave for all workers.

Two very different plans. https://t.co/102cnQWnKx

The previous Administration rolled back tough requirements on banks.

President Biden will ask Congress and banking regulators to strengthen the rules for banks to make it less likely that a bank failure like Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank happens again.

Today, President Biden highlighted actions this Administration is taking to address problems at Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank.

Americans can have confidence that our banking system is safe and taxpayer dollars will not be put at risk. https://t.co/9PIFlkmOYi

Generations of Americans have counted on Medicare and Social Security to be able to retire with dignity and security.

President Biden’s budget will protect and strengthen these programs without cutting a single benefit. https://t.co/ta7hyH7tC7

Cable, internet, and cell phone companies can charge you over $200 if you decide to switch to another provider. 

President Biden continues to call on Congress to pass the Junk Fee Prevention Act to eliminate these excessive fees so companies can no longer lock in consumers. https://t.co/Hn9HMDACzN

This Administration took action to reduce exorbitant bank fees by pushing banks to end bounced check fees and moving to ban surprise overdraft fees – saving consumers more than $5 billion a year compared to pre-pandemic.

President Biden has long believed we need to grow the economy from the bottom up and middle out.

A week defined by progress. https://t.co/teanGcSdNS

Two years ago, with a pandemic raging and an economy reeling, President Biden signed the American Rescue Plan.

Today, it’s led to the fastest economic recovery in the world, drove the strongest two years of job growth ever, put money in family’s pockets, and more.

This week, @POTUS laid out a budget that invests in America, lowers costs for families, protects Medicare and Social Security, and reduces the deficit.

MAGA House Republicans released a proposal that would give tax breaks to the rich, cut Medicare, and ship jobs overseas.

During President Biden’s first two years in office, he has achieved record-breaking deficit reduction – with the deficit coming down by $1.7 trillion.

His budget will build on this progress, bringing down the deficit by an additional $3 trillion over 10 years.
President Biden's economic plan has unleashed over $300 billion in private sector investments in manufacturing – ensuring the supply chain for America begins in America. https://t.co/UQzINGtWEA
President Biden’s budget expands access to free, high-quality preschool – making it available to all of the approximately four million four-year-old children in the United States.

President Biden’s budget will build on the progress we’ve already made giving families more breathing room by further lowering everyday costs – including for health insurance, prescription drugs, higher education, child care, utilities, and more. https://t.co/UvS4lqMrCI
While MAGA Congressional Republicans threaten to cut Medicare and Social Security, President Biden’s budget strengthens these bedrock programs that seniors have paid into their entire working lives.

More than 500 anti-LGBTQI+ bills have been introduced at the state level so far this year.

In the face of this record number of anti-LGBTQI+ bills, this Administration reaffirms its commitment to fighting for the safety and dignity of the LGBTQI+ community. We have your back.
President Biden’s economic plan is working. https://t.co/uNFLktP8gF

His budget will continue to lower health care costs by making lower Affordable Care Act premiums permanent, capping the cost of insulin at $35 a month for every American, and more. https://t.co/YRlvJivLol

President Biden is laser-focused on lowering costs for families – on everything from health care to child care.

Here’s how his budget will give you more breathing room: https://t.co/9jIW4GpZM1

Under President Biden’s leadership, we’ve made historic progress in growing the economy from the bottom up and the middle out – not the top down.

Today, he is releasing a budget to build on that progress.

President Biden’s budget will cut the deficit by nearly $3 trillion over 10 years by cutting wasteful spending on special interests and ensuring the wealthy and large corporations pay their fair share.

Congressional Republicans say they want to cut the deficit, but their plans would increase it by $3 trillion over the next decade.

President Biden’s budget will cut the deficit by $3 trillion over the next decade.

President Biden’s budget will fully fund Medicare for another generation without cutting benefits or raising taxes on anybody earning less than $400,000 a year.

Meanwhile, Congressional Republican plans would cut Medicare benefits.

Tomorrow, President Biden will release his 2024 budget and show the American people his vision to invest in America, lower costs for families, strengthen and protect Social Security and Medicare, and reduce the deficit.

Republicans in Congress should do the same.

This Administration is working with partners in every part of the world to expand economic security for women and girls, defend access to health care, safeguard women’s political participation and human rights, and promote the full participation of women and girls in society.

On International Women’s Day, the Biden-Harris Administration celebrates the accomplishments of women and girls around the world and reaffirms its commitment to ensuring that all people can reach their full potential. https://t.co/iuSvf2ojNU

President Biden’s Inflation Reduction Act gave Medicare the power to negotiate for lower drug prices.

Under his budget, Medicare will have the power to negotiate on more drugs.

Combined with expanded rebates for excessive price hikes, this will cut the deficit by $200 billion.

President Biden’s budget won’t just extend the life of Medicare – it will also lower costs for seniors.

By reducing prices for high-cost drugs, the budget will cut seniors’ out-of-pocket costs by billions of dollars.

President Biden’s budget will extend the life of Medicare for the Americans who rely on it, including by making the wealthiest pay more of their fair share – closing loopholes and raising taxes by about 1% on income above $400,000.
Tune in for a briefing with Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre. https://t.co/rqeh30teEk
Happy Holi from the Biden-Harris Administration! https://t.co/cOJnlfFmnN

President Biden’s budget will create savings by expanding his Medicare drug negotiation policy from the Inflation Reduction Act to cover more drugs.

These negotiations, combined with expanded rebates for excessive price hikes, will reduce the deficit by $200 billion.

Since Medicare was passed, income and wealth inequality in the United States have increased dramatically.

By asking the wealthiest Americans to pay their fair share, President Biden’s budget will keep Medicare strong for decades to come. https://t.co/5WHALxLc6W

This week, President Biden will lay out a budget that invests in America, lowers cost for families, protects and strengthens Social Security and Medicare, and reduces the deficit.

Here’s how he’ll get the job done on Medicare: https://t.co/HwlcWQHpo6

President Biden’s budget will ensure Medicare continues for at least another generation without cutting a single penny in benefits or raising taxes on anybody making less than $400,000 a year. https://t.co/wl13adlEoZ

President Biden’s Inflation Reduction Act finally gave Medicare the power to negotiate lower drug prices and requires rebates to Medicare if prices rise too fast.

This doesn’t just put money back in seniors’ pockets – it’ll also cut the deficit by $159 billion.

.@POTUS signed the Electoral Count Reform Act – which establishes guidelines for our system of certifying and counting electoral votes for President and Vice President.

This Administration is committed to protecting the sacred right to vote in free, fair, and secure elections.

Today, President Biden visited Selma, Alabama to commemorate the 58th Anniversary of Bloody Sunday – so that history can’t be erased – and highlight how the continued fight for voting rights is integral to delivering economic justice and civil rights for Black Americans. https://t.co/kIexNAu2dk

.@POTUS is urging Congress to restore the protections of the Voting Rights Act and take additional action by passing the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and the Freedom to Vote Act. 
 
This is the only way the nation can fully secure the right to vote in every state.

The nation's reaction to Bloody Sunday helped produce the Voting Rights Act, creating protections against racial discrimination in voting and providing equal access to the ballot.
 
Since their first days in office, @POTUS and @VP have prioritized protecting this sacred right.

Happening Now: President Biden delivers remarks on the importance of commemorating Bloody Sunday, highlighting how the continued fight for voting rights is integral to delivering economic justice and civil rights for Black Americans. https://t.co/Hzgh2TKqhQ

February 21: President Biden visits Warsaw, Poland to thank President Andrzej Duda and the Polish people for opening their hearts and homes to Ukraine.
 
February 22: The President meets with the Bucharest Nine nations – NATO Allies at the frontlines of Europe’s defense. https://t.co/WA92kY2pdq

December 21: @POTUS meets with @ZelenskyyUa at the White House, after which Zelenskyy addressed a joint session of Congress. @POTUS announces additional security assistance, including a Patriot air defense system, to Ukraine.
https://t.co/ufUn82SWLH

December 11: @POTUS calls @ZelenskyyUa to discuss how the U.S. is helping strengthen Ukraine’s air defenses and support Ukraine’s energy infrastructure in the wake of Russia’s targeted attacks.
 
And discussed the potential for President Zelenskyy to visit Washington.

October 10: In the wake of Russia’s missile strikes on critical infrastructure across Ukraine, @POTUS calls @ZelenskyyUa to express his condolences and reiterate the U.S. commitment to providing Ukraine with support to defend itself, including advanced air defense systems.

August 25: On Ukrainian Independence Day, @POTUS makes it clear the U.S. will support Ukraine’s defense of its sovereignty.

October 4: @POTUS and @VP speak with @ZelenskyyUa to underscore that the U.S. will never recognize Russia’s purported annexation of Ukrainian territory. https://t.co/nI7f1MxWYF

July 19: @POTUS and @FLOTUS welcome Ukrainian First Lady Zelenska to the White House to underscore that U.S. support for Ukraine is comprehensive, enduring, and focused on the Ukrainian people.
https://t.co/q8vWOfZsn6

June 1: The Administration authorizes critical security assistance for Ukraine, including High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems.
 
June 30: @POTUS attends a NATO Summit in Madrid, encouraging Allies and partners to continue to make significant contributions to Ukraine’s defense.

April 13: @POTUS announces new security assistance for Ukraine, including new capabilities like artillery systems, artillery rounds, and armored personnel carriers.
 
May 8: @POTUS speaks with G7 Leaders about maintaining unity and commitment to support Ukraine.

March 25: @POTUS visits U.S. troops, aid workers, and Ukrainian refugees in Poland for a briefing on humanitarian efforts, and delivers a speech in Warsaw rallying the free world to support Ukraine.
https://t.co/HfvRH7V9Yh
